website_summaries.verdict: A small Thunderbolt 3 docking station meant for on-the-go travel or for use in small spaces.
pros: 85W power delivery offers plenty of juice for most laptops and computer accessories
Compatible with most PC and Apple laptops
cons: Dual display setup suffers in performance when trying to use the full 4K resolution

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Does not work with Apple Thunderbolt display
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to power two monitors: an Asus (via DisplayPort), and an Apple Thunderbolt (via Thunderbolt 3, using an Apple Thunderbolt 2 -> 3 adapter as required). The dock doesn't work when plugged in. I have to unplug both monitors from the dock, and plug them back in (thunderbolt first) to get the monitors to work. It's harder than it used to be before I dropped $300 on a dock. I spent about 3 hours with tech support, confirming that everything was up to date and functional, before giving up. Huge waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up and Works Well - So Far
customer_reviews.text: 2018 MacBook Pro two weeks old. I've used the dock for 2 days at work. Ethernet, power, 2 monitors VGA with dongles for the Display Port and the USB Thunderbolt connection, a backup external hard drive. Set up was easy, hooked everything up and it worked perfectly the first time. Day one at lunch I had to reboot the computer for some reason, I don't know if it was the dock or something else. Day 2 no reboots, no issues. one nice feature is I charged my mouse overnight using the front USB port. I just need to remember to unmount the external drive if I unhook the computer. Great so far. I don't expect any issue.
customer_reviews.author: SCM

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for about three weeks then the Display port stops working
customer_reviews.text: I got this product in August 2018 and it worked fine and after 4 weeks, only one port began to work. I contacted StarTech and they were kind enough to replace it. Fast forward a couple of months later (February 2019). Same problem except one display output works at a time. It is a good product but it is not durable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Uma Abu

customer_reviews.title: Great hub for the new MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my new MacBook Pro 16". I wanted to daisy chain monitors using display port but this is not supported by Mac OS. Fortunately this doc has a display port and a thunderbolt port so I can run two external monitors as separate monitors. The build quality is good and the device is simply plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: E. Davila

customer_reviews.title: Died in three months, never worked right
customer_reviews.text: This has never worked entirely correctly, and now two months after the return window has closed it has given up completely. The power feed to the MacBook simply isn't working, and monitor detection is faulty as well. The MacBook won't boot while connected to this dock at all, and it can no longer detect attached peripherals. This is a garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: A Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT support dual monitors!
customer_reviews.text: Beware: This product does NOT support dual monitors! I have a 2019 15" MacBook Pro running macOS 10.14.6 Mojave, and I have two HP ZR2740w monitors (native resolution 2560 x 1440 @ 60 Hz). When I plug one monitor into the docking station and one monitor into my laptop, they both work fine. But when I plug both monitors into the docking station, they do not work. My mouse freezes/skips every few seconds, and I can't use the computer. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Iskenderian

customer_reviews.title: Nice Thunderbolt hub for Macbooks
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Thunderbolt hub that works well with 2018 and 2020 MBPs. Works well with the StarTech dual monitor DP KVM switcher, too! Tech support gets 5 stars for helping me source a replacement power supply quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Kusuma

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this Thunderbolt 3 dock for almost 2 years now. It's held up to being used between 4 computers with an eGPU, intense workloads, lots of peripherals, and tons of gaming. Not to mention the aluminum casing still looks like new despite all the use, and all the ports still work great. There isn't a TB3 dock I could recommend over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: The perfect Thunderbolt 3 dock.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a 2016 15" MacBook Pro connected to a myriad of usb peripherals and external hard drives (daisy chained through a Plugable USB3 hub), and two 4K monitors (Both 4K@60Hz). Handles everything beautifully with no hiccups. Everything feels completely native, and all hard drives operate at proper USB 3 speeds. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with Apple 2017 15" MacBook Pro and dual 4K/60Hz monitors
customer_reviews.text: Great dock! Connected it to my 2017 15" MacBook Pro, dual 4K/60Hz monitors (via DisplayPort and UBS-C connectors), gigabit Ethernet, and keyboard/mouse, and everything worked perfectly the first time without any issues, including simultaneously charging the MacBook. The included USB-C cable and USB-C to DisplayPort cables are high quality and the perfect lengths for my setup. The 85W power supply is reasonably sized and unobtrusive. I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a Thunderbolt 3 Dock that will work with my HP Spectre X360 4k 13.3 inch laptop for a very long time. This dock really performs as advertised. I just wish that I had found it earlier. This is really a fantastic device,easy setup, fast, well built, and I recommend it without reservation to anyone looking for a Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station. Thank you Startech.
customer_reviews.author: Wideglide

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with a macbook pro 15". One thunderbolt connection to the laptop and that givea you a display port and a thunderbolt port for displays along with 2 USB-A 3.0 and one USB-C. Pro tip. I connected a USB -C dongle to the thunderbolt port which gave me even the ports that I did not have(SD card reader). It is expensive but works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Aniket

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly with MB Pro
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues connecting this to my 2017 MacBook Pro 13” running macOS 10.3 and dual Dell 24” monitors connected via DisplayPort cables. No driver to install. Only thing I had to do is adjust the display config in Settings. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: GBrucker

customer_reviews.title: Wow,  great docking system
customer_reviews.text: Use it with my 2017 MacBook Pro. completes all the peripheral items I need to connect. Great hardware and serves the Apple products well.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Dettman

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, was bit difficult to set the dual screen but got it done but it’s very expensive compared to others docking stations
customer_reviews.author: Abu Shyed Md Nahian

customer_reviews.title: Broke down within a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last October (2018). It broke down suddenly two days ago. It doesn’t pass though either power or signal.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Dai

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: The Mac Pro is connected to peripheral devices and a 4K monitor and of course power. All the things work as expected. Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: CyberMyte

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Lenovo Yoga 920 so far
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my new Lenovo Yoga 920 so far. I only have one display (samsung), but its running 4k, 60hz fine via the display port. Charging my 65w laptop fine, ethernet plugged in, and I have 4 SSD drives (connected with targus usb-c mini hub dongle). My only complaint is the included cable is very short (1.7 feet), so laptop has to be right next to docking station and all my cables and drives. A 3 foot cable would have been ideal, and I see there are now 6 feet T3 cords now (at 100w, 40gb). Maybe even a discount for purchasers to upgrade cables, as T3 cables with these specs are expensive. Nonetheless, a nice product so far.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for my 2017 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2017 MacBook Pro and the LG Monitor sold by Apple. Great system except for the lack of USB ports and lack of power to use them. This product is exactly what I needed to flesh out my system and have lots of ports and lots of power to run them. Since it powers the laptop, I now have my original power supply as an extra for taking with me when I use the laptop away from home.
customer_reviews.author: P. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Works with Macbook pro+2 external monitors
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my 2018 Macbook Pro 13". I have it setup to run 2 external monitors plus my macbook monitor. I think the image is mislabeled because one of those cables is USB-C to USB-C. It's super short so I bought a longer one.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Review

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I'm driving two 1440p monitors @ 60Hz
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I'm driving two 1440p monitors @ 60Hz. I've used it successfully with a Dell XPS 15 9560 and a Lenovo X1 Carbon 5th Gen. Note, as expected, the Dell XPS 15 warns you only have 85W (not 130W) of power and that it may still draw power from the battery under load if you don't plug in another power source. In practice it seems to be able to both power the laptop and charge the battery fine under typical loads like web browsing. I wish it had more USB ports. To work around this I'm using a USB hub with it. Otherwise pretty much no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome hub. It's expensive, but with a MacBook Pro 15" 2017 it never gives me a hard time about finding my monitor on the DP port and "just working". Check the cables it comes with, you might be able to save buying a cable.
customer_reviews.author: Brett B Tofel

customer_reviews.title: Great dock - better than Dell OEM!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my new Dell XPS15, replacing a Dell TB16 dock. Substantial improvement. I can use cables of different lengths, better power delivery, and no "blinking screen" issues like those that plague the Dell. Just works!
customer_reviews.author: A Technogeek

customer_reviews.title: Best dock I've found for the money.
customer_reviews.text: While I needed to disable the Dell check to ensure a dock is Dell branded before letting you use use it, that is on Dell and I cannot possibly blame the dock. This dock works exactly as advertised and is nice and slim. The best part about it is that I can forget that I have it. I plug the thunderbolt 3 cable into my computer and it just works without incident.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this a great product, using it with Dell XPS 15 and running 2x 4K screens love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JavaScriptNinja.io

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great item, works just like it should and was plug-n-play simple. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R. Powers

customer_reviews.title: I have this, love this, and bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: I have this at work, and it's amazing. Convinced my boss to buy me one at one point, which got the rest of the team to ask for their own. Basically? You plug in one cord. When you've gotta go to another meeting, instead of unplugging a monitor or two, keyboard, mouse, power? You just plug in one cord. And instead of monitors plugging in in the wrong order or something, they always work exactly the same way; it just works. (Bought the second one for home, myself, about a year later. Also a win, in exactly the same way.) Both seem to be solid quality. The ones my coworkers got, also no problems. Would recommend, again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly useful
customer_reviews.text: Mr Trouble is using this in his Apple environment of a giant Mac and laptop and two monitors and some weird flat thing. Mr Trouble says that it is crucial to being able to multitask and to be able to complete tasks smoothly and being able to change from one system to another. He deals with giant files that are difficult to deal with, even open on some of his old Macs. His photographs are giant.
customer_reviews.author: Trouble

customer_reviews.title: Dual 4K monitor capable
customer_reviews.text: I got this to drive dual 4K monitors using a laptop. It worked. It handles the keyboard and mouse and inputs too, so overall a nice functional piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Forge

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Dock
customer_reviews.text: Startech's compact dock will power your laptop, drive 2 monitors, fast charge through the front USB panel and drive USB peripherals. Being able to drive an external monitor (or 2), is absolutely critical for most of the modern offices. Alas, our laptops will not do it alone. Startech provides an easy way to plug and attach your peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Makes the Macbook Pro useful
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Made my new Macbook Pro somewhat useful. (I could rant about how stupid Apple's design of Macbook Pro was, but I won't) Anyways, this works great. I only attached one monitor but I do audio recording so having the audio in is important. That all worked awesome. As did the ethernet port. So a very effective solution for making a MacBook Pro useful without a fistful of dongles. One note, the 170w power supply won't work on most airplanes, so don't be tempted to forgo the dongles and just bring this. You still need to buy all the dongles if you travel.
customer_reviews.author: AnarchyJim

customer_reviews.title: Very good docking station. Cable not long enough.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good docking station. Works fine with my 2017 macbook pro and Dell 5520 Precision laptops. Powers my macbook as well. Only removing one start because the cable isn't long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: This dock has almost all of the ports you’d want ...
customer_reviews.text: This dock has almost all of the ports you’d want. Dual 4K monitors, power delivery, checks almost all the boxes. Why it loses 1 star is the lack of a card reader. And it loses that star because a dock should be a sort of “make it a desktop.” And having to have a dongle takes away from that. But there are enough ports that you shouldn’t have to worry about 1 being used for a card reader. If I could only dock it half a star instead of a full I would.
customer_reviews.author: anonymousY

customer_reviews.title: Good but inelegant
customer_reviews.text: This dock works well (can drive two 4k displays via displayport), for example, two 27" monitors. But it's ugly, clunky, expensive, runs hot, and would be better with an extra USB port. The 1/8 headphone/mic ports are welcome. If you are more about function, and don't care about looks (or this is under your desk, for example, this is a fine buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mido

customer_reviews.title: Great thunderbolt dock
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my MacBook Pro. no issue and works as expected. Shipping was fast as well.
customer_reviews.author: T.S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for new Macbook Pros
customer_reviews.text: Despite what these reviews say, the TB3DK2DPW does not work with Macbook Pros. Nothing more needs to be said it simply is not supported by apple. Heck you for lying to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Recommended docking station!
customer_reviews.text: Working great for me so far! Make sure your devices are compatible - this device uses a Thunderbolt 3 (included). Pretty easy setup, good instructions and demos online. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Barrett

product_meta.title: StarTech.com Thunderbolt 3 Dock - Dual Monitor 4K 60Hz Laptop Docking Station with DisplayPort - 85W Power Delivery - 3-Port USB 3.0 Hub, Ethernet, Audio - TB3 Dock - Windows & Mac (TB3DK2DPPD)
product_meta.description: Great for video editing and other Ultra HD tasks, this Thunderbolt 3 dual 4K monitor docking station supports 40Gbps speeds and 4K resolution on two monitors. Run resource-demanding applications on two independent displays, without draining system resources. This TB3 dock lets you connect your laptop to: 1x 4K monitor via the DP port, 1x 4K monitor via the TB3 USB C port (6ft cable included) or 1x 5K monitor via the DP & TB3 USB C port. Simply connect the universal docking station to your laptop with included TB3 cable and start working immediately. No time-consuming driver installations are required. Set up a second monitor right out of the box using the included USB Type C to DisplayPort cable, eliminating the need for extra adapters. With three USB 3. 0 ports, the Thunderbolt 3 dock gives you plenty of ports for the latest and legacy devices. Connect USB devices like flash drives using the two Type-A ports. Keep your mobile device charged with the dock’s Fast-Charge and sync port. Connect a USB C device with the USB C port (5Gbps - data only). The Thunderbolt 3 port replicator features a 170W power adapter supporting Power Delivery to power and charge (up to 85W) your laptop, while powering all your devices connected to the dock. This eliminates the need to use two separate power adapters for your laptop and dock. This USB C Thunderbolt 3 dock features a rugged aluminum casing and is backed by a StarTech 3-year and free lifetime technical support.
feature_bullets: THUNDERBOLT 3 CERTIFIED DOCK: 40Gbps video/data bandwidth, dual 4K 60Hz DP & TB3 (USB-C) video outputs, 85W PD, USB 3.0 5 Gbps Hub w/ 2x USB-A (1 Front Fast-Charging) & 1x USB-C, GbE, 3.5mm audio/mic

85W POWER DELIVERY: This Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station will power and charge laptops & ultrabooks such as MacBook Pro 13 & 16, MacBook Air, HP, Lenovo ThinkPad, & Dell XPS using macOS, Windows & Linux
EASY TO SET UP & DEPLOY: Universal Thunderbolt 3 Dock w/ automatic driver setup & MAC Address Changer Utility; incl. Thunderbolt 3 host cable & USB-C to DisplayPort cable to connect 2nd DP monitor

FLEXIBLE THUNDERBOLT 3 PORT: Thunderbolt 3 port replicator with a downstream TB3 port that supports 3 modes of operation: a second monitor, daisychain TB3 peripherals, or connect USB Type-C accessories

DAISYCHAIN UP TO 5 THUNDERBOLT 3 DEVICES: Connect additional TB3 devices to this TB3 dock including monitors, external hard drive bays, card readers, or an external GPU; using the downstream TB3 port.

specifications.Series: StarTech.com Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station - with Power Delivery
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars85 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
